summary: The 'Final Determination' tag, in the context of these documents, refers to notifications issued by the Assassination Records Review Board (ARRB) regarding the release status of House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) staff payroll records. These notifications specifically address the postponement of releasing Social Security numbers to protect the personal privacy of HSCA staff members. The documents highlight the ARRB's role in balancing transparency with individual privacy concerns when releasing historical records related to the JFK assassination investigation. The notifications are associated with specific HSCA staff members such as Wendy S. Collins and Cynthia S. Cooper.
significance: In the JFK assassination context, 'Final Determination' notifications represent the ARRB's decisions regarding the declassification and release of sensitive records, balancing the public's right to information with the privacy rights of individuals involved in the original investigation. These determinations are crucial for understanding the extent to which information related to the HSCA's work is made available to the public.
